summary: This is an email chain from August 12, 2019, coordinating interviews of Bureau of Prisons personnel following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details a list of MCC employees to be interviewed, some to be served subpoenas, and logistics for conducting interviews away from the press at MCC.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Author of the email coordinating the interviews of Bureau of Prisons personnel. They are organizing FBI and OIG agents to conduct interviews and serve subpoenas.

connections.description: Both are FBI agents involved in the post-Epstein death investigation, with Special Agent coordinating the interview teams and SA needing an agent to accompany them for a technical review.

events.title: Coordination of BOP Personnel Interviews
events.description: FBI and OIG agents are organized to interview 11 Bureau of Prisons employees from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death. Three employees are to be served with subpoenas after their interviews.

locations: 9th floor interview rooms (location for interviews to avoid press)
keyFacts: The email is dated August 12, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, indicating the immediate launch of an investigation into the circumstances.
Eleven Bureau of Prisons personnel from MCC were scheduled for interviews, with three specifically slated to receive subpoenas, suggesting they were of particular interest.
Interviews were to be conducted on the '9th floor interview rooms' to avoid the press camped out at MCC, highlighting the high-profile and sensitive nature of the investigation.
The document reveals coordination between the FBI and the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) in conducting these interviews.
One FBI agent (SA) needed to review 'technical components at MCC,' which may refer to surveillance systems, logs, or other electronic evidence related to Epstein's death.
